# Scale: Major in C# (Mode: Phrygian, Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The major scale in C# with a Phrygian mode and D shape is a unique and versatile scale in the realm of music theory. This scale is based on the C# major scale but starts on the third note, resulting in a Phrygian mode. When played in the D shape on the guitar, it offers a distinct sound that can add a touch of tension and melancholy to your music.

## Notes and Intervals
- The notes in the C# major scale are: C# - D# - E# (F) - F# - G# - A# - B# (C)
- Phrygian mode starts on the third note of the major scale, so the scale becomes: E# (F) - F# - G# - A# - B# (C) - C# - D#
- The intervals in this scale are: Whole step - Half step - Whole step - Whole step - Whole step - Half step - Whole step

## Genre and Flavor
This scale is often used in a variety of genres including metal, flamenco, and jazz. Its distinct melancholic and exotic flavor makes it a popular choice for creating tension and drama in music. The Phrygian mode, with its unique interval pattern, adds an interesting twist to compositions, giving them a darker and more mysterious sound.
